content:
Nice clash. :) Not as hard as it seems at first.

One comment that's not really worth any edit to clarify: it's implied that the beakers don't have any markings for volumes other than their maximum volume, but most real-life beakers do. It's easy enough to realise this is implied though, and the statement is already long enough to not warrant a clarification, but I thought I'd comment it here for completeness. :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Took me quite a while, but definitely is doable in under 15 minutes, would only change a,b to mabye b_1 and b_2.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's an interesting fast problem to solve. It probably may take more than 5 mins in some cases as there are some tiny nuances to figure out. 

I am not a fan of the A, B, X names for the variables, but this is not that big of an issue.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: In my case, this clash took me longer than I anticipated, which is a nice surprise. The contribution is made properly clash sized by choices such as only two beakers, no case that will let a loop-approach time out, and not pouring into another. Nice work!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I've seen problems before, but never on this site. The fact I hadn't seen one on this site is a shame.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle for fastest mode!

Hi @Rick2200! The problem is nice but I find one thing confusing - the problem states that we need to measure X ml using beakers with sizes B and A and the solution uses only these sizes however we can also measure (B - A) water using these beakers (by filling B and pouring from B into A we get B - A in B). So I think you should clarify that such in operation is not possible.

Hi @Rick2200 :
-> you should avoid cases where automatic output [[N]] * "POSSIBLE" is a valid solution !
-> more generally, according to instructions, you may avoid "boolean equivalent" outputs,
-> thus, your "Small beakers" and "Large beakers" Test & Validators are not correctly paired each other ...
=> please : refer to guidelines ;-) !

I got many feedbacks and time is ripe for approving stage.

However, I got an issue, I can't set this puzzle state "Ready" somehow.
Whenever I tried to enable "Ready", my interface just turned into gray and there was no change. I can't even try to create new puzzles.

What should I do?? Does anyone know?

A couple thoughts.

I think the rule that we can only empty full beakers into some target reservoir, but not pour water from one beaker into the other, should be somehow established in the puzzle setup for clarity, as it is only apparent from provided test cases (say, measuring 5ml with {3ml, 4ml} would be possible otherwise).

Also, "EXACT amount of X mL water N times in a row" sounds confusing, mostly the "N times in a row" part. Something along the lines of "You are given a list of N amounts of water. Determine whether or not it's possible to measure exactly X ml using these beakers, for each target X.", maybe?

I think it would be possible to implement this in the reverse game mode as well. Maybe make the problem a little easier if you decide to do so, as finding the similarities could be difficult for the solver.

I think this could be a good CoC. 
It's actually simple enough and I like it! Good job

It might be because I'm not yet good enough but I'm not sure it will be completed by every one in under 15 minutes.

The only (kinda) negative I have to say is the example is not great because the big beaker is useless because 700 can be divided by 100 so maybe change the value of A to be 200. Otherwise the explanations are clear the tests take care of every case I can think of and the starting state is clear with explanations.
i suggest enable this on shortest. would be fun

Binary output issue
* Binary output should be avoided for clashes as per contribution guidelines. Currently there are only two possible answers: either "POSSIBLE" or "IMPOSSIBLE". There should be more possible answers.

Input
* Line 1: Please change "Two" to "Two space-separated integers for the".

* Line 2: Please change "The" to "An integer for the".

Cases
* As mentioned by @Braxis27, tests and validators should be similar but not the same. Please revise the cases.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.
You should change your validators, they should be similar but not the exact same as their corresponding test case.

Thank you for your feedback.
I updated some testcases.

Thank you for your feedback.
To avoid binary output, I made this multi binary output puzzle. Thus I added new variable N and made a small change in the statement.

Thank you for your feedback.
I think this puzzle is interesting for short coding too, but a bit difficult for usual clash of code shortest mode puzzles, maybe appropriate for fastest mode.
I need more opinions for deciding this game mode.

Thank you for your feedback.
At the first stage of creating this puzzle, I made "more than two beakers "  problem, which can be solved only by dynamic programming. But on the second thought, I noticed it's tough for most of coders, so I set the number of beakers 2, where a greedy solution or others can be applied. I think this setup can be reasonable for COC.

As for example statement, you are right. I'll change it to make it more understandable sooner or later.
Thank you for your comment:)

Thank you for your feedback.
I also this might be solved in reverse mode, but I think it's a bit hard, so I'm not going to apply reverse mode to this puzzle.

Thank you for your helpful feedback.
That kind of beaker operation is beyond my expectation. For clarification, I added some notes. Thanks.
Also, I made the problem statement more understandable in accordance to your feedback.
I would suggest you to try again. If it still fails, you may report the issue on #bug-report on CodinGame's Discord server.
NOTE: It's forbidden to pour water from one beaker to another.

Thank you for your information.
Issues were resolved and I can change this contribution status.
I also think that it could be a good puzzle in shortest mode

That's fine. Thanks.

Two more fixes:

Input
* Please change "The water" to "An integer for the".

Output
* Please change "[[N]] lines containing" to "<<[[N]] lines>>:".

Thanks again.
